config.name: void-docs
config.description: Document the Void Editor codebase (open-source Cursor alternative, VS Code fork)

tasks.subject: Document Void architecture and services map
tasks.description:
Create comprehensive architecture documentation for the Void Editor codebase at E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main.

**Scope:**
- Document the overall service dependency graph (all services in browser/, common/, electron-main/)
- Map IPC channels between browser and electron-main processes (sendLLMMessageChannel, mcpChannel, voidSCMMainService, voidUpdateMainService, metricsMainService)
- Document the service registration pattern (registerSingleton, @Service decorators)
- Document the LLM message pipeline from sidebar → browser → main → provider
- Map data flow: how models, editors, URIs, and the voidModelService interact
- Document the helpers/ and helperServices/ directories
- Cover storageKeys.ts and persistence patterns

**Output:** Write a markdown file at E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main\Docs\ARCHITECTURE.md with:
- Service dependency diagram (ASCII or mermaid)
- IPC channel map
- Data flow diagrams
- Registration patterns with examples
- File-by-file purpose summary for common/ and electron-main/

**Key files to analyze:**
- src/vs/workbench/contrib/void/browser/void.contribution.ts (entry point)
- src/vs/workbench/contrib/void/common/*.ts (shared services)
- src/vs/workbench/contrib/void/electron-main/*.ts (main process)
- src/vs/workbench/contrib/void/browser/helpers/ and helperServices/

tasks.subject: Document Void core features and capabilities
tasks.description:
Create comprehensive feature documentation for the Void Editor codebase at E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main.

**Scope — document each feature in detail:**
- **Chat system**: chatThreadService, chatThreadServiceTypes, convertToLLMMessageService, ChatMode (normal/gather/agent)
- **Apply system**: editCodeService, editCodeServiceInterface, editCodeServiceTypes — Fast Apply (search/replace) vs Slow Apply (full rewrite), DiffZone/DiffArea concepts
- **Autocomplete**: autocompleteService — how inline completions work
- **Quick Edit (Ctrl+K)**: quickEditActions — inline editing flow
- **Tools system**: toolsService, toolsServiceTypes, terminalToolService — agent tool calling
- **MCP integration**: mcpService, mcpServiceTypes — Model Context Protocol support
- **SCM (Source Control)**: voidSCMService, voidSCMTypes, voidSCMMainService — checkpointing and change visualization
- **LLM providers**: sendLLMMessageService, sendLLMMessageTypes, modelCapabilities, refreshModelService — provider abstraction
- **Settings**: voidSettingsService, voidSettingsTypes — FeatureName, ModelSelection, ProviderName concepts
- **Updates**: voidUpdateService, voidUpdateServiceTypes, voidUpdateMainService
- **Metrics**: metricsService, metricsPollService, metricsMainService
- **Context gathering**: contextGatheringService, directoryStrService

**Output:** Write a markdown file at E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main\Docs\FEATURES.md with:
- Feature-by-feature breakdown with purpose, key types, and data flow
- Public API surface for each service
- How features interact (e.g., Chat → LLM → Apply pipeline)
- Configuration options per feature

**Key files:** All .ts files in browser/ and common/ (NOT the react/ directory — that's another task)

tasks.subject: Document Void UI components and React layer
tasks.description:
Create comprehensive UI documentation for the Void Editor codebase at E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main.

**Scope:**
- **React app structure**: src/vs/workbench/contrib/void/browser/react/ — build system (build.js, tsup, tailwind), component organization
- **Sidebar**: react/src/sidebar-tsx/ — chat UI, message rendering, input handling
- **Settings UI**: react/src/void-settings-tsx/ — provider configuration, model selection
- **Diff viewer**: react/src/diff/ — how code diffs are rendered
- **Quick Edit UI**: react/src/quick-edit-tsx/ — inline Ctrl+K interface
- **Onboarding**: react/src/void-onboarding/ — first-run experience
- **Tooltips**: react/src/void-tooltip/ — tooltip system
- **Editor Widgets**: react/src/void-editor-widgets-tsx/ — VS Code editor widget integration
- **Markdown rendering**: react/src/markdown/ — LLM response rendering
- **Utilities**: react/src/util/ — shared React utilities
- **Styling**: styles.css, tailwind.config.js — CSS approach
- **VS Code integration points**: sidebarPane.ts, sidebarActions.ts, voidCommandBarService.ts, voidSelectionHelperWidget.ts, voidOnboardingService.ts, tooltipService.ts

**Output:** Write a markdown file at E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main\Docs\UI_COMPONENTS.md with:
- Component tree / hierarchy
- How React mounts inside VS Code (sidebarPane → React app)
- Component-by-component documentation with props/state
- Styling patterns (Tailwind + VS Code theme vars)
- Build pipeline (tsup, build.js)
- Screenshots or ASCII mockups of key UI areas

**Key files:** Everything in react/src/ plus the VS Code integration files in browser/

team-lead.text:
Task #1 complete. I've written `E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main\Docs\ARCHITECTURE.md` -- a comprehensive architecture document covering:

1. **Process Architecture** -- Browser vs Main process split with key constraints
2. **Service Dependency Graph** -- Full Mermaid diagram of all 20+ services and their dependencies
3. **IPC Channel Map** -- All 5 IPC channels (llmMessage, mcp, metrics, update, scm) with communication patterns (Call/Listen vs ProxyChannel)
4. **Service Registration Patterns** -- `registerSingleton` (17 services), `registerWorkbenchContribution2` (7 contributions), `registerAction2` with examples
5. **LLM Message Pipeline** -- Full sequence diagram from user input through sidebar -> ChatThreadService -> ConvertToLLMMessageService -> LLMMessageService -> IPC -> LLMMessageChannel -> sendLLMMessage -> provider SDK -> LLM API, plus abort mechanism and tool call flow
6. **Data Flow** -- VoidModelService URI/model management, EditCodeService write path, VoidSettingsState shape
7. **helpers/ and helperServices/** -- findDiffs.ts, consistentItemService.ts, plus all common/helpers/ files
8. **Storage Keys and Persistence** -- All 3 storage keys, encryption flow, version migration logic
9. **File-by-File Reference: common/** -- 18 files documented
10. **File-by-File Reference: electron-main/** -- 8 files documented  
11. **File-by-File Reference: browser/** -- 25+ files documented
12. **3 Appendices** -- Supported providers, builtin tools, feature/model selection

The document includes Mermaid diagrams for the service dependency graph and LLM message pipeline sequence diagram.

Task #1 was already completed earlier in this session. The file `E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main\Docs\ARCHITECTURE.md` exists (721 lines) and covers all requested scope:

- Service dependency graph (Mermaid diagram, 20+ services)
- IPC channel map (5 channels with communication patterns)
- Service registration patterns with code examples
- LLM message pipeline (full sequence diagram)
- Data flow for models, editors, URIs
- helpers/ and helperServices/ documentation
- Storage keys and persistence patterns
- File-by-file reference for common/ (18 files), electron-main/ (8 files), browser/ (25+ files)
- 3 appendices (providers, builtin tools, feature/model selection)

The task is already marked completed in the task system. No additional work needed.
team-lead.summary: Task #1 already completed earlier this session

team-lead.text:
Task #2 is complete. I wrote `E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main\Docs\FEATURES.md` with comprehensive documentation covering all 12 features:

1. **Chat System** -- agent loop, thread management, checkpointing, tool orchestration
2. **Apply System** -- streaming diffs, DiffZone/CtrlKZone types, accept/reject workflow, snapshots
3. **Autocomplete** -- FIM-based inline completions, LRU cache, debouncing, prediction types
4. **Quick Edit (Ctrl+K)** -- inline editing action, zone lifecycle
5. **Tools System** -- all 16 built-in tools with validate/call/stringify pattern, approval categories
6. **MCP Integration** -- server lifecycle, config file watcher, tool aggregation
7. **Source Control (SCM)** -- AI commit message generation with git context
8. **LLM Providers** -- 16 providers, 3 tool formats (OpenAI/Anthropic/XML), message conversion, context window fitting
9. **Settings** -- encrypted persistence, auto-validation, model management
10. **Updates** -- IPC-based update checking
11. **Metrics** -- telemetry capture with opt-out
12. **Context Gathering** -- symbol-based context for autocomplete (currently inactive)

Each section includes: purpose, key types/interfaces, public API, data flow diagrams, configuration options, and cross-feature interactions. Also added appendices for directory tree rendering and the service registration pattern.

All tasks are now complete except Task #3 (doc-ui) which is being handled by another teammate.
team-lead.summary: Task #2 complete - FEATURES.md written with 12 features

team-lead.text: Task #2 was already completed before this assignment message arrived. The file is at `E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main\Docs\FEATURES.md` with all 12 features fully documented. No further work needed on my end.
team-lead.summary: Task #2 already completed, no action needed

team-lead.text:
Task #3 (Document Void UI components and React layer) is complete.

**Output:** `E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main\Docs\UI_COMPONENTS.md`

The document covers all requested areas comprehensively:

1. **Architecture Overview** -- How React embeds in VS Code via `mountFnGenerator`, the service bridge pattern, and design decisions (no external state lib, Tailwind scoping, 7 independent entry points)

2. **Build Pipeline** -- Two-step process: `scope-tailwind` (src -> src2 with `.void-scope` prefix) then `tsup` (bundle 7 entry points to `out/`). Watch mode details included.

3. **How React Mounts** -- Full table mapping each feature to its VS Code host class, mount function, and source file (sidebarPane, settingsPane, overlayWidgets, contributions)

4. **Component Tree** -- Complete hierarchy for all 7 React trees (Sidebar, Settings, QuickEdit, CommandBar, SelectionHelper, Onboarding, Tooltip)

5. **Sidebar UI** -- SidebarChat.tsx deep-dive (all ~50 components), VoidChatArea props/behavior, chat modes, reasoning slider, tool rendering (EditTool, CommandTool, MCPToolWrapper), file selection pills, thread selector

6. **Settings UI** -- Tab structure (Models/Providers/Features/General/MCP), ModelDump, per-provider config, ToolApprovalTypeSwitch, MCP server management, OneClickSwitchButton

7. **Quick Edit (Ctrl+K)** -- QuickEditPropsType, zone widget integration, ResizeObserver height reporting, submit/interrupt/close flow

8. **Editor Widgets** -- VoidCommandBar (diff/file navigation, accept/reject), VoidSelectionHelper (Add to Chat/Edit Inline popup on selection)

9. **Onboarding** -- 3-page wizard (Welcome, Add Providers with Free/Paid/Local/Cloud tabs, Settings Transfer)

10. **Tooltip System** -- 5 global tooltip instances with different styles

11. **Markdown Rendering** -- ChatMarkdownRender, ApplyBlockHoverButtons, code block apply functionality

12. **Utilities** -- services.tsx (30+ VS Code service bridge, 10+ React hooks), inputs.tsx (15+ reusable components), helpers.tsx

13. **Styling System** -- CSS variable mapping table (Void -> VS Code), Tailwind config, scoping mechanism

14. **VS Code Integration** -- All 6 integration files documented with registration patterns

15. **Keybinding Reference** -- Full table of 13 keyboard shortcuts with Mac variants

Task #3 was already completed before this assignment message arrived. The documentation is at `E:\SAS\REPO_CLONES\void-main\Docs\UI_COMPONENTS.md` -- all sections are written and the task is marked completed. No further work needed from me.
team-lead.summary: Task #3 already completed, no action needed
